======================================================================== The output is : Time in India (Format)Friday, April 26, 2002 6:36:18 AM GMT+05:00 Time in India (Format) Time in India (Parse) Thu Apr 25 18:36:18 PDT 2002 The output of parse does not reflect the timezone set. Also in the case the timezone is explicitly set using the timeZone attribute , the output is in the local time zone (i.e. PDT)

text:
Note that when you parse a date string whose time is fully specified (as in your
example), the time zone included in the date string always has precedence over
the enclosing <fmt:timeZone> or 'timeZone' attribute.

Note that the parsed date is output using Date.toString(), which is why you see
"PDT" as its time zone.
